which Shakespearan character is the famous lover of Juliet?

Romeo is the lover of Juliet in famous drama Romeo and Juliet written by William Shakespare. Romeo died by drinking poison for his love for Juliet thinking she was dead. She drank the same poision and dies when she woke up and find Romeo dead.

what chemical is added to water in swimming pool?

which of the following is the title of Shakespeare's play?

which word mean for somebody who tends to expect the worst?

A pessismist is a person who tends to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen. The words cynical and misanthropic are common synonyms of pessimistic. Opposite of pessimists are optimists who see the positive side of things and expect things to turn out well
which animal is said to always land on their feet?

Cats always land on their feets beacuse they have an inbuilt balancing system called the “righting reflex” that allows which allows them to turn while in the air, so that they land safely on their feet.Using their sensitive ears, they are able to maintain balance and orient themselves, so they are not injured from a fall

where do you go to board a plane?

when a woman is going to have a baby it is said to be?

Women become pregnant when a baby grows in their womb. Pregnant women stay 40 weeks or 280 days or 9 months on the average before they can be delivered of the baby. Pregnant women are also called expectant mothers
what is used to power an automobile?

Gas or gasoline is the most common automobile fuel and is used all over the world to power cars, motorcycles, scooters, boats and other machinery. Gas are of three types based on their octane levels - Regular gas has the lowest octane level of 87, Mid-grade gas has an octane level of 89 and Premium gas has the highest octane levels from 91 to 94.
how many legs does a fish has?

Fish has no legs because they don't need them. Fish, as a type of animal, evolved before the evolution of the four legs that define tetrapods. A kilobyte (KB or Kbyte) is a unit of measurement for computer memory or data storage. Originally, a byte was considered a collection of 8 bits, the smallest number of bits that were able to express a number, letter or character within binary. A kilobyte is approximately 1,000 bytes (specifically, 2 to the 10th power or, in decimal form, 1,024 bytes).
If soccer is called football in England, what is American football called in England?

American Fotball retains its name 'American Football' in England.British people refer to soccer as 'football' This is because 'football' is the most popular sport in England. The British use the term 'American football' to refer to game known as football in the US
What is the largest country in the world?

Russia is the largest country in the world with a total area of 17,098,242 Km² (6,601,665 mi²) and a land area of 16,376,870 Km² (6,323,142 mi²), equivalent to 11% of the total world's landmass of 148,940,000 Km² (57,510,000 square miles)
A doctor with a PhD is a doctor of what?

PhD is short for Doctor of Philosophy. This is an academic or professional degree that, in most countries, qualifies the degree holder to teach their chosen subject at university level or to work in a specialized position in their chosen field.
What state is the largest state of the United States of America?

Alaska is the biggest state in the U.S., covering an area of 663,267 square miles, which is more than twice the size of Texas, the second largest state. Which ocean borders the west coast of the United States?

Pacific Ocean borders the United States by the west coast. The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of Earth's five oceanic divisions. It is bigger than the total size of all the continents on Earth combined.
What is the fastest land animal?

Cheetah is the fastest land animal, capable of running at 80 to 98 kmph compared to the fastest man Usain Bolt top speed of 44.72 kmph. It accelerates faster than a Lamborghini due to its lightweight body, small head and long legs are designed for aerodynamics
What is the name of a rabbit's abode?

Burrow is a hole or excavation in the ground made by an animal (such as a rabbit) for shelter and habitation. Most rabbit species in the wild live in underground burrows that they dig. Harvard University is located in which city?

Harvard University is located in Cambridge, Massachusetts US. The founders of the University named the city in honour of the University of Cambridge in England, which was once a major centre of Puritan theology of the city’s founders.

Which city is the capital of the United States of America?

Washington, D.C. became the capital of US as a result of The Residence Act of July 16, 1790, which put the nation's capital in current-day Washington as part of a plan to appease pro-slavery states who feared a northern capital as being too sympathetic to abolitionists. Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and the smallest planet in our solar system. It's a little bigger than Earth's Moon and it is also shrinking in size. Because Mercury was the fastest planet as it moved around the Sun, it was named after the Roman messenger god Mercury

The colors of the United States flag are red, white and blue. The colors of the flag are symbolic as well; red symbolizes hardiness and valor, white symbolizes purity and innocence, and blue represents vigilance, perseverance and justice

how many days are in a week?

what is used to tell time?

A clock is a device used to measure and indicate time. Christiaan Huygens, however, is usually credited as the inventor. how many seconds are there in one minute?

one door closes and another door..?

what does not kill you makes you....?

What doesn't kill you, makes you stronger comes from an aphorism of the 19th century German philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche. It has been translated into English and quoted in several variations, but is generally used as an affirmation of resilience.

Lara Croft is from which video came ?

which of the following force of nature is always referred to as a cyclone

what are you doing if you're singing to the accompaniment of audio tapes?

citrus fruits are good sources of which vitamin?

what colour is a traditional wedding dress?

The tradition of white wedding dress for brides likely traces back more than 2,000 years, with roots in the Roman Republic (509 B.C. - 27 B.C.) when brides wore a white tunic. The color white represented purity, symbolizing both a woman's chastity and her transition to a married Roman matron

by what name is sodium chloride more commonly known?

which is these is produced by insects?

Honey is a sweet and viscous substance made by several bees. Bees produce honey by gathering and then refining the floral nectar or the secretions of other insects. on which part of the human body are taste buds located?

What is the largest continent on Earth?

The largest continent on Earth is Asia, both in terms of land area and population. Asia covers an area of approximately 44.58 million square kilometers and is home to more than 4.5 billion people, which is more than half of the world's population.

what is the name for the headquarters of US department of Defense?

which colour is not found in a rainbow

it's better to be loved and lost than ...?
never to have loved at all

The adage 'It's better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all' means that even the pain of a lost love is worth bearing if one can first experience the joy of love. never to have loved at all
what is the last letter of the English alphabet?

Z is the 26th and last letter of the English alphabet. Z is a consonant. Z is known as Zed in British English and Zee in American English. Around 300 BC, Z was taken away from the alphabet by Appius Claudius Caecus, and a new letter, G, was put in. However, In the 1st century BC, Z was put in the alphabet again at the end of the Latin alphabet.
which vehicles compete in the annual tour de France ?

The first Tour de France is an annual biycycle race first held in 1903 – with the aim of selling more newspapers. It was set up and sponsored by French sports paper L'Auto, which hoped a tough new endurance race around the country would capture the public's attention and boost its declining sales figures.
what title is given to the son of a king?

what does the letter E stands for in the abbreviation E-mail?

what do you call a stick of coloured wax used by children for drawing on paper?

how many sides are there on a triangle?

what word associates a spider with the internet?

on which date is April fools' Day

the CD used for storing digital data stands for what?

which is not one of the five senses?

what is the capital of Iraq

What is the largest organ in the human body?

what kind of substance is zinc?

which English playwright wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?

which country has the oldest written constitution still in existence

What is the largest ocean on Earth?

who is the shaggy man beast that supposedly lives in Himalayas?

The "shaggy man beast" you are referring to is likely the Yeti, also known as the Abominable Snowman. The Yeti is a mythical creature that is said to inhabit the Himalayan region of Nepal, Bhutan, and Tibet.

The rococo style of art originated in what country?

1804 J M Jacquard invented first programmable device - what

In 1804, Joseph Marie Jacquard, a French weaver and inventor, developed the Jacquard loom, which is considered to be the first programmable device.

What does lager literally mean in German
